Lima-Filho} and Marcelo Bourguignon and Rodrigo {B. Silva}},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

previous_headings: Control Charts for Sample Mean of Gaussian, Inverse Gaussian, Gamma, and Beta Prime Distributions
title: Control Charts for Sample Mean of Gaussian, Inverse Gaussian, Gamma, and Beta Prime Distributions
text: Control Charts Sample Mean Gaussian, Inverse Gaussian, Gamma, Beta Prime Distributions. package generates pseudo-random numbers distributions described title batches samples. obtains maximum likelihood estimates index distributions sample means respective distributions. calculates control limits statistics monitoring performance control charts, ARL (Average Run Length), MRL (Median Run Length), SDRL (Standard Deviation Run Length). possible specify true parameters unknown simply provided. case, package obtains estimates using maximum likelihood method. done using following functions: stats_n(): normal distribution; stats_ig(): inverse Gaussian distribution; stats_ga(): gamma distribution; stats_bp(): beta prime distribution. details, please refer “Reference” tab package.

previous_headings: Control Charts for Sample Mean of Gaussian, Inverse Gaussian, Gamma, and Beta Prime Distributions
title: Control Charts for Sample Mean of Gaussian, Inverse Gaussian, Gamma, and Beta Prime Distributions

title: Calculate statistical measures for the inverse Gaussian control chart — stats_ig
text: data data matrix. alpha significance level. mu mean parameter distribution (optional). lambda shape parameter distribution (optional). ... Additional arguments passed limits function.

title: Calculate statistical measures for the inverse Gaussian control chart — stats_ig
text: list containing estimated parameters, alpha-hat, ARL, MRL, SDRL, control limits, convergence status, value objective function.

title: Calculate statistical measures for the inverse Gaussian control chart — stats_ig
code: set.seed(0) x <- r_ig(lots = 1000, n = 10, mu = 1, lambda = 1.7)  # Estimate for maximum likelihood stats_ig(data = x) #> $mu_hat #> [1] 0.9923649 #>  #> $lambda_hat #> [1] 1.861464 #>  #> $alpha_hat #> [1] 0 #>  #> $ARL #> [1] Inf #>  #> $MRL #> [1] -Inf #>  #> $SDRL #> [1] Inf #>  #> $li #> [1] 0.4929123 #>  #> $ls #> [1] 1.902939 #>  #> $convergence #> [1] 0 #>  #> $value #> [1] -93.64581 #>   # Using the true parameters stats_ig(data = x, mu = 1, lambda = 1.7) #> $mu_hat #> [1] 1 #>  #> $lambda_hat #> [1] 1.7 #>  #> $alpha_hat #> [1] 0 #>  #> $ARL #> [1] Inf #>  #> $MRL #> [1] -Inf #>  #> $SDRL #> [1] Inf #>  #> $li #> [1] 0.4798106 #>  #> $ls #> [1] 1.97604 #>  #> $convergence #> NULL #>  #> $value #> NULL #>
